result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Discovery received. Offer received counter offer recently sent out Atty. Cupino would like an additional scheduling conference.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements  - GPS & monitor alcohol - device TBD by the day reporting staff

11:29  AM Defendant Manuel DeJesus Morales-Rivera appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Paul Christopher Dedinsky in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by video for Manuel DeJesus Morales-Rivera. Interpreter Susan Rascon sworn in. Defendant advised of rights. Received complaint/waived reading. NG Plea entered. 950 Macy's law complied with. Probable cause found in the complaint. 11:45 AM back on the record, appearances are the same. Bond set.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
